alert.note: Alert for Chilton (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:56PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Chilton County through 530 PM CDT... At 455 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Jemison to Billingsley. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Calera, Clanton, Jemison, Thorsby, Plecher, Pooles Crossroads, Minooka Park, Lomax, Isabella and I 65 Rest Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
